result.execSummary:
The defendant Alejandro Ruiz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alejandro Ruiz

Ct 1: 946.49(1)(a)-Misd Bail Jumping; Ct 2: 946.49(1)(b)-Bail Jumping-Felony. No contact with victim ZM's person, property, residence or family.   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Alejandro Ruiz in court with attorney Michelle Marie Anderson.  Defendant Alejandro Ruiz in custody.  James D. Newlun appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Maggie Techert.
Defense asks bond be modified to signature bond. Deft will reside with family members in the State of Illinois but deft does have significant ties to the State of Wisconsin. The State does not object.

BTC: Bond to be modified to $5000.00 signature bond - terms and conditions previously ordered remain  Status conference scheduled for October 20, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Conditions:  No contact with victim ZM's person, property, residence or family.   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
